title: OPTUS internet high ping spikes/lag?! (AUS)
body:
TL;DR:  Anyone else have OPTUS internet having huge ping spikes/ bouts of lag during normal games?


Hello everyone, the past few weeks I have had a whole lot of trouble with my internet and playing LoL. 

I have spoken to two other people in game when we were getting laggs, both of these people including " DeadShambala" have OPTUS as their ISP and from what they explained to me, sounds very very similar to what problems I'm dealing with too. 

Basically, Bot games are fine. I can play a whole game vs bots (with 4 other real human players) without a lag the whole game. As soon as I join a normal game and a enemy champion comes into my view (screen) I lag up, not every time but quite often. During teamfights especially.

EDIT: A few months ago the same sort of thing happened to OPTUS, normal internet would work fine but LoL and a few other random things wouldn't work properly. It might be this again. I'm trying to work out if its just me or what...

replies.body: I too have Optus and they are horrifically bad. I get the same problem in CS:GO with ping shooting up from a stable 74 to around 980. It stays there for a while before steadily declining again. It makes crucial situations impossible to comprehend.  I legit have the beefiest computer ever so it's got nothing to do with my hardware. I honestly feel like calling Optus up and telling them how much of a joke they are. 'Unlimited' bundle my ass.

That's frame lag, not internet lag, and it's an issue that was introduced with the most recent patch. I've got a beast computer setup that normally runs Crysis and max settings with 1000 frames a second (may be exaggerating) but I've noticed that in team-fights my FPS drops twenty frames or so. This normally never happens.

Hopefully a red notices soon and makes a hot-fix. If that doesn't happen then we're stuck with this issue for a *long* time.

it is not FPS lag, I do know the difference. I have consistent 60fps (capped) that never falters. 

My ping goes to 3000ish.

Oh.

>As soon as I join a normal game and a enemy champion comes into my view (screen) I lag up, not every time but quite often. During teamfights especially.

That is literally what happened to me where upon my frame-rate would drop. On top of that, it's only been happening on the most recent patch. Of course, I won't deny that these thing can't be related at all but they're probably not.

Press Ctrl+F in game. What does your ping jump to when you have these lag spikes?
I just played a game and another player was spamming 'lag' in the chat every time I lagged up too. So I am left thinking it is not just me, yet again.
